intro: Paraboea salicina var. major, commonly known as the broad-leaved paraboea, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
